trustfund:
TF050093-GEF2 PDF B -
            MOLDOVA:PREPARATION OF AGRICULTURAL POLLUTION CONTROL PROJ,TF053023-GEF3 FSP-MOLDOVA:AGRICULTURAL
            POLLUTION CONTROL PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Agricultural Pollution
            Control Project for Moldova were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            Bank performance was moderately satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            sustainability and replicability of communal waste
            management depends on local authorities' commitment.
            Train a project implementation unit (PIU) member in
            procurement procedures to aid understanding of fiduciary
            unit requests and improve cooperation. If a PIU under a
            sectoral ministry is in charge of technical aspects, and a
            fiduciary unit under another ministry is in charge of
            procurement and financial management,
            miscommunication/confusion about responsibilities will delay
            implementation. Timely fund allocation, irrespective of
            financing source, maintains implementation pace, and project
            credibility among grant recipients and contractors. Plan for
            mitigating possible resource use conflicts and access
            restrictions when restoring wetlands as a small component in
            a large nutrient reduction project. Be prepared to allocate
            more time to social issues than the share of the activity in
            the overall project costs.
